alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lee; Southern Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Lancaster, northwestern Lee, Chesterfield and northern Kershaw Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 555 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Wadesboro to near Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge to near Liberty Hill. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cheraw, Bishopville, Chesterfield, Westville, Cheraw State Park, Northeastern Technical College, Cassatt, Cheraw Municipal Airport, Carolina Sandhills Wildlife Refuge, Mt Pisgah, Mcbee, Society Hill, Patrick, Bethune, McFarlan, Lucknow, Chesterfield Ruby Middle School, North Central High School, Cheraw Fish Hatchery, and Middendorf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
